alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 9:12PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN DOUGLAS AND NORTHWESTERN WASHBURN COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM CDT... At 911 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wascott, or 25 miles northwest of Hayward, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wascott and Gordon around 920 PM CDT. Solon Springs around 930 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
